Prison Term Demanded for Hanchongryon Chairman
articles.content:
Prison Term Demanded for Hanchongryon Chairman 
    Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean security authorities reportedly demanded five years in prison and five-year suspension of qualification for Jong Jae Uk, 11th-term chairman of the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon), on the charge of violation of the "Security Law" at a trial on July 15.
 The prosecution committed this outrage, taking issue with the demonstration denouncing the present "government" in Mangwol-dong, Kwangju, and the inaugural ceremony of Hanchongryon which were held while he was active as chairman.    
 Jong Jae Uk in the court accused the authorities of suppressing Hanchongryon and exposed the injustice of the SL.

articles.title: Favorably Developing DPRK-Russia Friendship
Greetings to Foreign Minister of Malta
articles.content:
Greetings to Foreign Minister of Malta 
    Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Michael Frendo upon his appointment as foreign minister of Malta.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to favorably develop, the message sincerely wished him great success in his responsible work.

Delegation of Ministry of Foreign Affairs Leaves for Asian Countries
articles.content:
Delegation of Ministry of Foreign Affairs Leaves for Asian Countries
    Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Ministry of Foreign Affairs led by Vice-Minister Kim Yong Il left here Monday to visit Asian countries.
 The delegation was seen off at Pyongyang Railway Station by officials concerned, the Vietnamese, Cambodian and Mongolian ambassadors and the Laotian charge d'affaires ad interim in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Koreans in Japan
    Pyongyang, July 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and conversed in a compatriotic atmosphere with the delegation of Koreans in Japan led by So Man Sul, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, staying in the socialist homeland at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.
 On hand were officials concerned.
